title: ICE running `x.py doc`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I'm not sure this is actually considered a bug, as it happened while running `./x.py doc` in the rust repo. It started working after running `./x.py clean`, so maybe there were something left in the cache from an earlier version of the compiler. ### Code I did not change any code in the compiler, and it happened after pulling, and updating all submodules. ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: I'm not sure how to do this as it is the bootstrap(?) version I'm running I've put all of the relevant compiler output in the backtrace summary, including the backtrace, and the query backtrace.
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no entry found for key', compiler/rustc_metadata/src/rmeta/decoder/cstore_impl.rs:632:9 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at
